alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 7:31PM EDT until July 31 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard affecting Perry County. North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson affecting Breathitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 43.1 feet, Flooding will exceed the highest flood on record. Large sections of the town are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 41.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EDT Thursday was 41.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 43.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 42.9 feet on 05/30/1927. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued by 1 AM EDT Friday.
